blocks.name: dfcgrg2
blocks.content: Congruence for two triangles can also be defined as congruence of sides and angles (6 parts). This is often the actual textbook definition of triangle congruence, see for example ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congruence_(geometry)#Congruence_of_triangles With this definition, the "SSS" congruence theorem has an additional part, namely, that triangle congruence implies congruence of the sides (which means equality of the lengths). Because our development of elementary geometry strives to closely follow Schwabhaeuser's, our original definition of shape congruence, ~ df-cgrg , already covers that part: see ~ trgcgr . This theorem is also named "CPCTC", which stands for "Corresponding Parts of Congruent Triangles are Congruent", see ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congruence_(geometry)#CPCTC (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 18-Jan-2023.)

  simp2d(wa(w0, wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), cfv(ccgrg, c3), cs3(c4, c5, c6))), wceq(co(c1, c7, c2), co(c5, c7, c6)), wceq(co(c0, c7, c1), co(c4, c7, c5)), wceq(co(c2, c7, c0), co(c6, c7, c4)))

  trgcgrg(c0, c1, c2, cfv(ccgrg, c3), c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, c3, w0)

blocks.name: isoas
blocks.content: Congruence theorem for isocele triangles: if two angles of a triangle are congruent, then the corresponding sides also are. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 5-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm isoas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), co(c0, c1, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cds, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(citv, c5))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(clng, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cstrkg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wo(wcel(c3, co(c0, c7, c2)), wceq(c0, c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(cs3(c0, c2, c3), cfv(ccgra, c5), cs3(c0, c3, c2)))
} = {
  cgr3simp3(c0, c1, c2, c0, c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(ccgrg, c5), c3, c2, w0)
  eqid(cfv(ccgrg, c5))
  tgasa(c2, c3, c0, c5, c3, c2, c0, c4, c1, c6, c7, w0)
  ncolrot1(c0, c2, c7, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  axtgcgrrflx(c2, c1, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  cgraswaplr(c2, c3, c0, c5, c3, c2, c0, c4, c6, c1, w0)
  cgracom(c0, c3, c2, c5, c0, c2, c3, c4, c6, cfv(chlg, c5), w0)
  eqid(cfv(chlg, c5))
}

thm isoas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[c1]c2)=(c0[c1]c3))
  ⊣ c4 =(Base ` c5)
  ⊣ c1 =(dist ` c5)
  ⊣ c6 =(Itv ` c5)
  ⊣ c7 =(LineG ` c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈ TarskiG)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → ¬(c3 ∈(c0[c7]c2)∨ c0 = c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → <" c0 . c2 . c3 ">[(cgrA ` c5)]<" c0 . c3 . c2 ">)
} = {
  cgr3simp3(c0, c1, c2, c0, c3, c4, c5, c6, (cgrG ` c5), c3, c2, w0)
  eqid((cgrG ` c5))
  tgasa(c2, c3, c0, c5, c3, c2, c0, c4, c1, c6, c7, w0)
  ncolrot1(c0, c2, c7, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  axtgcgrrflx(c2, c1, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  cgraswaplr(c2, c3, c0, c5, c3, c2, c0, c4, c6, c1, w0)
  cgracom(c0, c3, c2, c5, c0, c2, c3, c4, c6, (hlG ` c5), w0)
  eqid((hlG ` c5))
}
